website_summaries.verdict: For committed Amazon Alexa users who make frequent use of Alexa to set timers, the Echo Wall Clock is a low-risk, almost frustration-free add-on they should find useful.
pros: An affordable, easy-to-use accessory for Echo device owners that helps make it easier to keep track of any timers you set with Alexa
cons: A minor hiccup with the batteries during setup seems like sloppy QA on Amazon's part
The plastic body feels a bit cheap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2nd room notifications!
customer_reviews.text: Short and sweet review - paired with Kitchen echo device and hung in living room so that the timers can be viewed there. In the kitchen, I can already see the timers on the Echo Show so makes perfect sense to put this in the living room. Love the device. I will be getting another to put in garage so that I can see the kitchen timers there if needed. Hope this short review helps you somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: wetcoast79

customer_reviews.title: Blocks/Disables echo's Bluetooth receiver feature???
customer_reviews.text: Clock works, as every 10-dollar wall-clock does. However, it seems to occupy echo's Bluetooth channel so that as long as the clock is connected, the echo could not be used as a Bluetooth receiver any more. E.g. my echo is connected to a speaker and it acts as a Bluetooth soundbar for my TV. I also use this setting as a Bluetooth speaker and stream music from my phone. The introduction of this clock breaks everything else. I will attempt a bit more before I have to return it to Amazon. Would appreciate if Amazon could clarify if this behavior is by-design.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great clock!
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Dropped rating down to 4 stars. After a couple days of working great, it lost connection to the Echo. Came home and the clock was wrong, and the timer did not work. Alexa App said it could not connect to bluetooth device. Pushing the pair button did nothing. It would not pair until I temporarily removed the batteries. -- original review -- This is a neat clock. Keeps perfect time and lets me watch my Echo timers from a different room. No ticking, it's as quiet as a mouse. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: TruthMaster

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have double digit Amazon devices. I thought this would be a great add on in the kitchen. It won't stay paired, now won't pair at all. Amazon contacted me to try and get it t work. It worked for a VERY BRIEF time. After all that, the arm simply fell off. DON'T waste your money. This is the worst Amazon product I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Honner

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my house.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool. Nice looking, not too flashy, able to set multiple timers etc. Attached is a (should be) video of me setting several timers, canceling some, letting some of one expire etc. Note that ALL of the ALEXA AUDIO is coming from my Echo Dot. The clock itself makes NO noise. ZERO. Nothing. I did not initially understand that the clock had no real interactions One On One with a you, You must go through an Alexa device. The good thing is if you have an Alexa device in your kitchen (OR WHEREVER), and this clock, they will not compete against each other.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable. Worked for only 2 days. Recommend against buying
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly for only 2 days. Then began losing time. Tonight it was behind 20 minutes. Now I have to go thru the hassle of returning it. I wish they would have tested these things for reliability.
customer_reviews.author: D. Neunaber

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately and no multi-room support
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to put this in the kitchen and use the timers for cooking. Opened the box and set it up (which was admittedly easy) but within 15 minutes the time diverged from reality. Shortly after we also realize the timers won’t work if your paired device is playing music on a multi-room group (I believe the Bluetooth is taken for that functionality and can’t talk to the clock). Since we often listen to music while cooking, this was extremely limiting. If it can’t tell time and can’t set timers I’m not sure what good it is. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: No more adjusting clock!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a wall clock that I did not have to adjust for day light saving time or any other time. Finally here; wish they could make it a little bigger. Easy setup and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Garcia

customer_reviews.title: update: now working
customer_reviews.text: It is paired with my dot, timers work but the clock hands always go to 12 and don't display the correct time. Update: now working. I deleted it from the remembered Bluetooth devices then I had to pair it through the app, then after it paired and got stuck at 12 I removed and replaced the batteries. After powering it back on it repaired automatically and set the correct time after about 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ed willson

customer_reviews.title: "Sorry, I'm not sure"
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today and it looks good. Here is my experience though with setting it up: 1. Mine didn't come with a battery cover. It does come with batteries. The clock works fine without the cover. 2. Had to upgrade my Echo Dot before pairing. No big deal but it does add to the setup time required 3. Lost connection pairing the first time, succeeded the second time 4. No instructions on actually how to use it 5. Ask, "Alexa, how do I use my Echo Wall Clock?" She says, "Sorry, I'm not sure" The time is set correctly. Will see how hard it is on batteries (takes 4 AA batteries which are included)
customer_reviews.author: Edward Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not working when Multi-room Audio is playing is a major issue.
customer_reviews.text: The clock works well as do timers. This is as long as you don't have the paired Echo playing music in a Group, then the timers don't work at all on the clock. The app says not supported when playing Multi-room Music. What were the programmers thinking? Batteries just died this weekend, So only just over 3 months of battery life. :(
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: More Connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of no issues, I'm now having the connectivity issues I've heard about from others. Amazon, you having problems again? I love the clock in general. I think it would be cool if they had multiple colors for multiple timers. Red for the shortest timer, blue, green, yellow, white, etc depending on how many timers were set. Update: I discovered the connectivity issues are due to multi-room music playing. Apparently Bluetooth doesn’t work when playing music in multiple rooms, so the clock disconnects during those times. Seems like a terrible flaw that Amazon needs to work out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Comment_leaver

customer_reviews.title: Wait until you have to change the battery lol
customer_reviews.text: I dread the time when I have to change the battery because I have to pair the stupid clock again. You would think it's a straightforward process, it’s not! For something that you have to keep constantly changing the battery, you would think they would make this process easier. Nope. Or the fact that you have to rehanging this clock again in the walk which is depending on how high it is, can be a challenge in its own. I’m more staring at the clock wondering why the heck it’s not syncing after I press the blue button and after Alexa told me to do so. This product is just not good.
customer_reviews.author: Starlord

customer_reviews.title: Giving this one one more try
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine less than a month and it is not working now. When you try to sync up with your Alexa app on your phone, it cannot find the wall clock device. Pairing has been an issue. Sending back for a replacement. Going to try it one more time. I know this is a new item that came out in September, so there may be some kinks that need to be worked out. If I can get it to work properly and stay working, I know I’ll be happy with it. I love Alexa products.
customer_reviews.author: OlafsMom2

customer_reviews.title: Fancy idea with problematic design
customer_reviews.text: I am big fan of Alexa. However this Echo Wall Clock is the worst product I've ever had. A few issues: 1. The battery life is short. I had to replace them every three weeks. 2. Problematic pairing with Echo. This is the big problem. I've spent hours so far. In the recent failure, I've following the instructions, first tell Echo to "Setup Echo Wall Clock". Then press the blue button in Echo Wall Clock back side for about 4 seconds, it shown orange light. Then start pairing. About 5 minutes later, the Echo Wall Clock turned to blue. Then it turned to red immediately. I've tried many times. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this trash
customer_reviews.text: Let's start by saying I was excited for a few minutes... Until we tried to put the second batch of Christmas cookies in the oven. It turned red (error mode) as soon as we turned on music. Who doesn't listen to Christmas music while making cookies? The idiots who engineered this trash seem to think it is fine that (and this is well known) the timer won't work when multi room music is playing, so it's trash.
customer_reviews.author: nathan s

customer_reviews.title: Item defective, never paired
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to pair to a 3rd Gen Echo Dot. During the pairing process, the light on clock pulses orange for one minute, then display solid red. I tried a second of batteries, but results were the same. Returned without trying a replacement device, as reviews here indicate a higher rate of defects than I expect from an Amazon branded product.
customer_reviews.author: Original Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: super easy to setup and works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: took just a minute or two to get it connected to my Echo. it sets the time automatically. times show up on the clock in an easy to read way. and if you cancel a timer it will stop displaying on the clock. works well so far. looks nice and just works! ill be interested to see how long the batteries last, but that will take some time to test.
customer_reviews.author: Strid3r

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: Well it worked really good for about 10 months. It was easy to set up. It was great at keeping time. It was good for a cooking timer. Then it died at a young age. It first wouldn't light up for my timers. I changed the batteries, but that didn't help. Then it wouldn't even keep time. I tried resetting it a couple of times, but it didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection to Echo Show All the time
customer_reviews.text: Drops the bluetooth connection and then the time resets to 12:00. It keeps time, but the displayed time will of course be incorrect because the time is being reset to 12:00 rather frequently. The clock isn't able to maintain a connection to the Show 2 for more than 24 hours. The clock and Show2 are in the same room and about 25 feet apart. Have to remove batteries to reset it and even then is difficult to re-pair. I hope Amazon engineers release an update soon. VERY BUGGY.
customer_reviews.author: robby818

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Dec 2019. It worked great for 6 months. Then, the blue light came on, which means it disconnected from my echo and I had to reconnect it. It worked for a couple more months. Then, blue again then orange. So, I replaced the batteries but couldn't reconnect. I had performed the total reset process. Amazon says upgrade firmware, but how? Anyway, it would work for a few days, then blue and disconnected, the orange, dead batteries. Today, I threw it in the garbage and am now leaving this review. Worst...product.....ever. Based upon other feedback and off site reviews, I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Detrick

customer_reviews.title: If you are didicated to smart home accessories, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to look up from my couch and see how much time I have left on dinner. The clock sets automatically after pairing. A couple of high capacity batteries and this is a low maintenance addon to your smart home. My main complaint with Echo's in general is the inability to see timers from other echos. I wish they were an option to sync timers accross devices. I hope more accessories like this keep coming.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Bush

customer_reviews.title: Time to Buy a Different Clock
customer_reviews.text: This clock worked OK for the first couple of months I owned it. For reasons unknown, it went dead on me and the hands are stuck at 12:03. I have changed the batteries, tried disconnecting and re-connecting to my Echo Dot, but cannot get it to (a) connect and (b) to sync. Pretty darn expensive for a glorified timer.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Geary

customer_reviews.title: strange build quality
customer_reviews.text: This allows me to see timer countdowns in the TV room for the timers that I set in the kitchen, so that's handy. Also, it's a self-setting clock that is never wrong, so there's that. OTOH, any $6 plastic clock from IKEA will have a 30 cent plastic crystal on it to protect the hands. This clock comes with stern warnings: "Don't touch the hands. The clock will be ruined if you move the hands." Yet, the hand are exposed. So, ... what? I can't even dust the thing? It's a baffling omission.
customer_reviews.author: R. N. Winters

customer_reviews.title: Only works for one hour
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea, but this clock only works for one hour after set up, then timer won't show up on the clock. Tried the set up three times, every time the clock only works with my echo for one hour then no connection to echo any more for timer, low quality.
customer_reviews.author: M. li

customer_reviews.title: Drains battery fast and stopped pairing after 3.5 months
customer_reviews.text: Good as a laundry timer and self-adjusting clock, but it uses 4 AA batteries they drain super fast. My other regular clock works for 1+ year with 1 AA battery. Well it has bluetooth and fancy timer, that's understandable, however, after recent batteries ran out, I put in new batteries, but it stopped pairing with my Echo Dot. Alex app on phone cannot see it. When I put it in the pairing mode, Echo Dot still kept saying it cannot find it. It's cheap but still I would still expect something slightly more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: T Wang

customer_reviews.title: An incredible Echo accessory
customer_reviews.text: I just got it and used it for all the Christmas baking. Set up was incredibly easy, just put in the batteries and tell Alexa to set it up, and it did. Also it moves the hands to the correct time, so don't try setting the time manually, you can break it. They should have a big warning sticker as I did just that, but luckily nothing broke. The LED behavior was very well thought out, and useful as a visual indicator to your Echo device.
customer_reviews.author: Will Morris

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself some time. Get a good clock, not this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Horrid would be the first word I can think of. Everything else is unprintable. If you get this junk paired with Alexa. Good for you. Be careful not to rely on it for the time as it will jump forward two hours, then three, then stop altogether. Amazon has such confidence in this waste of plastic that they don’t even include it in its list of objects. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Koeppel

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves this Clock
customer_reviews.text: It ended up in her master bath to time her electric toothbrush. She has an Echo Show in her dressing room, which pairs with the clock. I bought it because it will always be accurate, relative to the time server that synchronizes the Show. She complained about a self-setting "radio clock" failing to update properly, this was the perfect solution + it has a timer function. Simple, minimal, nice design, works. Easy to pair with the 1st Gen Show. Always accurate. It updates for DST automatically. Will likely purchase a second one.
customer_reviews.author: nesnet

customer_reviews.title: Love the clock the rare times it happens to work
customer_reviews.text: I bought the clock in the first batch, receiving it before Christmas. In the few weeks I've had it I have had to set it up over a dozen times. Almost daily it loses connection to the echo dot located 6 feet away. I have to disconnect it through my Alexa app, remove and replace a battery to clear the clock, then go through the entire set up process each time. I hope this is a software problem they can fix, but right now I wouldn't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: reader71

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't show time in the dark!
customer_reviews.text: Overall the clock feels great during day time, setup is easy, looks cool, displays alarms and timers very well but the clock doesn't show time in the dark. Such a big disappointment. I expected that the hands and the minute marks would be at least fluorescent and can be seen in the dark. Nope. Alexa clock team, please do something about this.
customer_reviews.author: Venkata Ramayya M

customer_reviews.title: It is terrible to pair and if you ever lose power it will never pair again. It’s GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the clock I followed the directions for pairing and it took 6 tries before it worked. I recently lost the power in my home for about two hours and now can not get the clock to pair again. I have already tried at least 20 times and it still will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lori B.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps disconnecting, and is a real problem to reconnect.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, then power when out in the home. Clock did not and would not reconnect to the current 2nd generation DOT. I tried numerous attempts to reconnect with failure. I decided to try and reconnect with a generation 3 appliance. Bingo it worked. My fear is I am being forced into upgrades. UPDATE: Today is 12/14/19. Yesterday the clock just quit working. It is high towards ceiling so nothing can touch it. I tried all evening to get it to connect again. After numerous tries it finally is keeping time and timer works. However, the light on clock continues to flash orange, it should be a solid blue. UPDATE: 12/1619. Clock quit working completely!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Can’t keep time
customer_reviews.text: This is the first clock that needs to be rebooted every 2 days to get back in sync. Any updates to fix the Bluetooth from dropping out?
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: Pairing methodology needs some serious work
customer_reviews.text: My first Echo clock kept disconnecting from the Alexa in our kitchen so Amazon offered to send are placement. The same thing keeps happening. After a while the Bluetooth connection stops. I have tried taking the batteries out multiple times and going through the whole set up again and after a while, it might be days or weeks, it disconnects. It’s just too frustrating so we got a regular kitchen clock. The Echo clock also goes through way too many batteries. It should be updated to have a rechargeable battery. Sadly, this one is destined for the trash bin. Does Amazon make one of those?
customer_reviews.author: heywatchit

customer_reviews.title: Battery eater
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and sync with Alexa. Fun to use as a timer. I like watching the LEDs count the time down. But, even the most costly lithium batteries last a short variable time depending on how the clock is used. If you just let the clock sit on the wall, the batteries may last a long time. I use the timer function. The batteries lasted just under a month. The clock does not speak. But, the is a BlueTooth function. Alexa easily sets the timer. The timer is accurate. Alexa beeps when the time is up. Actually a nice functional piece to own.
customer_reviews.author: DocHolliday

customer_reviews.title: Terrific clock, lacks style!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this clock for the connectivity as we expand our Amazon Echo throughout the house. I had a hard time giving up how beautiful my old wall clock was, so I got creative. I took the round stainless steel frame from old clock, and this was the result. What amazon needs to do now is make these clocks much more stylish. I am happy to have a one of a kind now though. ;o)
customer_reviews.author: Jordan L. Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Hands fall off easily, hard to see how to line them up, App keeps freezing for factory reset.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this clock, but we cannot keep it set to the correct time. The hands of the clock fall off very easily. When I try to reattach them, it is difficult to see where they belong to line them up. And, when I try to factory reset the clock, my Alexa app freezes so I can't actually do it. I cannot maintain a correct time and feel like the amount of time I've spent on trying to make this work has been worthless. A waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Bridges

customer_reviews.title: If you are pairing with an Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: Great clock- attractive and functional. However, we struggled when attempting to pair with the Echo Show. Customer service was unable to assist. They suggested we return the clock and offered to refund. As loyal Amazon fans, we refused to accept defeat. The set up instructions say to pair using a voice command or the app. However, neither works with the Echo Show. The correct way to pair on the Show: voice command "Alexa, go to settings" Then, using the touchscreen on the Show, go to Blue Tooth, find the device (Echo Show) and pair.
customer_reviews.author: Calibluesky

customer_reviews.title: Wont stay connected all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Update. I have had this for quite awhile now and when it works, it works great. It still randomly keeps Dropping the bluetooth connection and then the time resets to 12:00. The clock isn't able to maintain a connection to the Show for more than a couple hours. The clock and Show are in the same room and about 10 feet apart.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great idea just very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased at launch Winter 2018 and broke right outside the warranty window. Went through two sets of batteries in 90 days and arms now hang at 6:30. Dead. Review of the 1st 90 days. We loved it. Especially if you cook and allows multiple timers. Aesthetically pleasing to the eye as well. Modern decor look.
customer_reviews.author: A. Orfgen

customer_reviews.title: Constant Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: I hate writing a one star review (I don’t think I ever have before) but Amazon definitely has some issues with this clock or its firmware. Like many, connects, works, and about 2 hours later it’s the wrong time and not communicating. I would imagine that this would be resolved in the future, but online search provides no insight whether an update is coming (or if it can be) I would generally say it’s defective and order a new one, but I can clearly see I’m not the only one with this issue. Here’s hoping it gets better with an update, timers are a really cool Function.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work right if you’re playing multi-room audio
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, and it will get plenty of use. My only gripe, and the only reason that this is not ranked 5 stars, is that the timer functions do not work if the paired echo is being used to play multi-room audio. It seems that this clock falls victim to the same issue that prevents echo remotes from working when you are actively playing multi-room audio (which is something I do a lot!)
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Kull

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, and now it doesn't...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed having this clock in our kitchen. We use our Alexa dot a lot to set timers for various things and we were always having to ask how much time was left on the timer. It's easy to read when multiple timers are set and when the batteries run low, the circle on the front shows red. What I don't like is that after 1 year it just stopped working. I've tried multiple batteries and nothing seems to work. I'm disappointed that it only lasted a year. Otherwise, I'd love to still be using it.
customer_reviews.author: StaciW

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Handle this thing like your holding an egg that's already half cracked in your hand... The arms for the time fall off really easy and when they do your clock is done... The pictures look like it has a glass front. It doesn't so these fragile little arms they put on it, they are open to everyone to touch them. One fall from 3 feet to the ground while mounting it and it fell apart... What a poorly designed product. The timer features work pretty well to look from a glance though. If you can use it without the arms this is a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works Nice but CHEAP looking UPDATE: worse than expected
customer_reviews.text: Does its job — we’ve had no issues. But looks really cheap. Made of flimsy plastic with no protection for the clock face and hands. Doubt will last long. Can’t believe they skimped so much on build quality. Even a this price point not worth the money. Would have been much better to spend a few dollars more to produce something that looks nice as most may put it in central areas of your house. Screams CHEAP even from across the room. Update: after several months with this clock it is getting trashed. Constantly loses connection. Even with good batteries time does not stay accurate. Not worth $5 much less $30.
customer_reviews.author: PLTK

customer_reviews.title: Nifty addition to echo family
customer_reviews.text: We really like the echo wall clock. We bought it to help our child with ADHD learn the concept of time. It has helped. I wish there was a setting where you could set the timer to a specific time (set for 8pm). That way kids can count down until it is time to go and understand what time they have to leave. Maybe it will be added in a future software update. We did have some trouble setting it up, but we did the factory reset and then we have not had an issue since.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months, No cover over clock face, only 90 day warranty
customer_reviews.text: It's handy but not reliable or well made. Mine stopped after about 5 months, contacted Amazon only to find out there is only 90 day warranty and they will do nothing (even though this was the first model and they knew there were known connection issues.) Besides it breaking, the biggest fail is there is no cover over the face, and since most will use this in the kitchen, it gets greasy and not easy to clean so even if it does not break it will not last. Also, it's battery pig, 4 AA batteries and they only last a couple of months. So much for Amazon backing up their products!
customer_reviews.author: Ted in Cal

customer_reviews.title: The kids don't ask Alexa how much time is left on the timer anymore!
customer_reviews.text: When batteries died after 1 month I had to re-pair it. Pairing is harder than you think. You have to remember to connect it to a particular Alexa device under bluetooth settings. Also, the blue status light sometimes lights up at night. Electrical tape solved that. I'd prefer to have a setting that tells the clock to only use that light when there is an error (not for notifications). Being blinded at night with a blue light on the wall is really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity Skies

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, cheap cheap quality.  Lasted a year, then minute hand fell off.
customer_reviews.text: The concept here is great -- a clock that sets itself and nicely shows your Alexa timer! However, it's built like a Dollar Store trinket. There is NO COVER.. I've never seen a clock with no glass or plastic dome cover. Dust collects inside the clock, of course, which isn't so easy to clean. Worse, the minute hand just outright fell off and got lost, probably thrown away. The rest of the clock will follow it into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tech TangoTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good-but needs a plastic cover for face
customer_reviews.text: Attractive, easy to read, easy install, no problems with batteries, but will use rechargeable when supplied batteries are exhausted. Avoid sources of potential interference like microwave devices and radio frequency devices, and motors as much as possible - I suspect that these may cause repeated loss of communication, followed by signal seeking and re-setting. If my theory is correct, that will cause shortened battery life. ALSO - who thought it was a good idea to design a kitchen device with no cover to protect from indoor kitchen pollution? Just a flat piece of plastic would have protected face, hands and mechanism from kitchen airborne grime and pollutions. How about a cheap third party solution?
customer_reviews.author: genie

customer_reviews.title: This is a Horrible Product that eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: The clock is a nightmare to pair and re-pair. Mine goes through a set of fresh new batteries every month The blue light flashes constantly all the time for no reason, its 6 feet from my echo The product does not show up in the alexa app like everything else does. When you replace the batteries every month you have to go through a very long process to make it work again!! Skip for now and possibly buy later when the product is on another version. You will notice it only has a 90 day warranty. Amazon would prefer you to buy this and then throw it away after warranty expires. (day 91)
customer_reviews.author: Trae Stubblefield

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable and may cause frustration. Unpairs often.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pair by using an Echo device (Alexa app on phone won’t work). Once initial pair was successful the times worked well. The time up signal is subtle with the echo device ringing a mild tone and the wall clock flashing. You have to tell the Echo device to stop ringing. HOWEVER, the wall continuously unpairs itself and it is not found when I ask Alexa to set up a timer in the wall clock. Alex will then set up a timer on the Echo device. Frustrating. Not reliable, and may cause frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Buatkokk

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding complement to echo, especially for students!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding complement to echo, especially for students! It adds view of timers for studying. It links to echo so no need to check time. There are simple signals to indicate if battery is low. I love the simple design. I have not had a single problem with them, and the batteries that came with them have been running strong for a month at this point. My boys have been using them to self manage their study and play time. Just for that is well worth it. Although echo provides timer, the visual clock timer lets them see exactly how much time is remaining at an instant
customer_reviews.author: Gary Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking.  Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one of these clocks in about nine months. When it works, it's very nice to have both a stylish, accurate wall clock and a visual indicator of timers that I have running on my Echo Dot. But, it comes un-synched from the Echo Dot regularly. This results in the timer indicator not working and the time on the clock not being reliable. The wall clock sits about 12 feet and straight line of sight to the associated Echo Dot (3d gen), so it is well within range of what should work. Good idea, poor implementation.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The interface with Alexa is as easy as it gets. The clock itself is attractive, with a clean simple upscale look. The countdown inside one minute gives a really helpful visual indication of when the time is going to be completed. We use it all the time. But I sure wish it had a second hand or a way to continuously monitor seconds. There are times I just want to measure the time between occurrences, or the time between exercises. For a premium high tech clock it really seems odd to have left that out.
customer_reviews.author: Tbones

customer_reviews.title: Great little addition to my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Simple design works well in kitchen. Feels like fairly cheap plastic housing but shouldn't get rough-housed hanging on the wall. I would have given 5 stars except it was more expensive than it should be and there should be a bezel covering the face of the clock. The literature WARNED not to touch the hands of the clock, so therefore a bezel covering the face and hands would certainly prevent accidental movement of the hands. Seems like a pretty simple fix to me.... so now I'll worry when I dust it that I may mess something up! Otherwise works as expected and was VERY easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Ring

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Poor battery life, pairing problems It's not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.text: I am really really disappointed in the quality of this clock. It uses up the 4 AA batteries quickly, and it's a real pain to pair with another echo device. Amazon needs to greatly improve the quality, performance & reliability of this clock. I have thrown 2 of them away after less than 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Flaat

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 6 months, 45 min on phone, reset 4 x , dead clock  ;(
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after 6 months, 45 min on phone with customer service rep who was nice and but could not get clock to work, reset clock 2x, echo 1x, remove and install battery 1x, dead clock. Also tried to reset with Alexa application with no luck, I like it when it works and hope I can get it replaced. Warranty??
customer_reviews.author: CJ reviews

customer_reviews.title: After a Quick Hour of Set up I realized it was worth it.
customer_reviews.text: First off, the darn hands on this thing are SO sensitive. Taking the clock out of the packaged I bumped the minute hand and it threw everything into chaos. After finally figuring out how to take the hands off and reset everything we were finally ready to rock and roll. I set this up in my kitchen along with my second generation dot. I cooked dinner with multiple timer set and the clock was an amazing accessory to my Echo. Instead of asking Alexa 15 time how much time I had left on the chicken or the pasta I could just give a glance to the wall. Highly suggest it for that time saver alone. JUST DON'T TOUCH THE HANDS!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: This product is junk
customer_reviews.text: Frequency disconnects from Echo. If it is not connected, the clock feature will not work. The unit drains the battery quickly, no matter the brand. I get a 1 - 1.5 months of use before changing batteries. This is with limited use of the timer feature. The best feature is the timer when the clock works. The 90 warranty is lackluster. 5 months in, and I came to the conclusion that this is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September of 2019 with a lot of hope. It worked great, while it lasted. A few weeks ago, it stopped responding. It came with cheap Amazon batteries, so I figured I'd just replace them. Nope. No response after a half dozen attempts to re-sync with the Show that sits feet away. Even moved the clock closer to the show. Loved it while it lasted. $26.99 down the drain. I guess I may just stop being an Amazon early adopter. Let them work their kinks out before I buy.
customer_reviews.author: ROMAD

customer_reviews.title: So verry useful, but delicate and a bit wonky
customer_reviews.text: This clock is fun and extremely useful -despite all the bugs with getting it to sink with Alexa and having to change batteries fairly frequently. Last week, my clock was completely nonresponsive. Ordered on December 30 2018, I was really frustrated! I did could to revive the device with new batteries and using the paper troubleshooting guide and finally got help from customer service - the clock is working again. (Happy days are here again!) This device is delicate. Follow all instructions carefully, and hang the clock where you can easily reach it to re-sync and change batteries. It is such a great device, but demands attention and troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wellstead

customer_reviews.title: You don’t need one, until you get one.
customer_reviews.text: It’s one of those products that you don’t need but really like the fact that you have it. Very useful in the kitchen. You can set up several timers. The lights are bright. It just look a bit cheap. Well, it’s cheap. I would rather pay a bit more for something that does not look so much like a plastic clock.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetGuy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly as described, worth every penny. I can not wait to see if it gains additional abilities. But what it is today is enough to justify buying
customer_reviews.author: HS Tulsa

customer_reviews.title: Way too fragile
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the Echo Wall Clock I thought it was a good way to connect it to my Alexa Dot. The concept is good but the way its built is all wrong. Theres no cover to protect the hands on the clock and if you touch either one it will stop working correctly as stated in the instructions. If it's that fragile why isnt it protected?
customer_reviews.author: M. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Been working fine for me at least 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I keep mine 6 feet away from the Echo and works fine. Still using original batteries for months. Like all bluetooth its sensitive to interference. You need to keep other bluetooth or 2ghz devices away from it. I wish there was backlighting. Etc. But it's a low cost clock and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: ner_do_well

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poorly executed
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this clock. The ability to interact with Alexa, display timer status - great idea! However, it was VERY poorly executed. To start with, no face cover. The item is sold as something that could be used in a kitchen. How are you suppose to keep this clean? Other reviewers have said that if you touch/move the hands - it basically ceases to work correctly. Put a .05 plastic cover over it Amazon! Next, unable to read at night time. Boy, if only someone would invite a paint that glows in the dark. ?????? Finally, I would like to see the date displayed as well. (I did not take away for this on the rating.)
customer_reviews.author: rjhansen63

customer_reviews.title: Works great once you figure out how to set it up
customer_reviews.text: The setup instructions look simple, but honestly the comment from Alexa that it should be set up in the Alexa app is it's saving grace. I tried setting it up just using my echo dot at least 2 dozen times & it never worked correctly. Not with multiple factory resets, taking the batteries out overnight, etc. The first time I tried it in the Alexa app itself, it worked perfectly. So please benefit from my annoyance & skip right to that step.
customer_reviews.author: TheSCOTTS

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for first gen
customer_reviews.text: First of all, why would you make the only color white? Doesn't blend with my kitchen at all. Construction feels flimsy. Easy to pair with echo dot but its really very basic and needs more functionality. Not worth $30, truly a first generation product. I'm sure eventually there will be more styles and function.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you're not expecting much
customer_reviews.text: Due to a number of poor reviews, I wasn't really expecting much. So far it works well enough. Mine is about five feet from my Kitchen Echo and it hasn't lost its connection after a week or so. It's not as cheaply made as I thought it would be. It only does two things, show you the time and show you timers. So far it's doing both. Being able to set multiple timers is more convenient than I thought it would be while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Misunderstood Computer God

customer_reviews.title: Good single function item.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: once set up, works great. Easy to read, great for cooks and bakers, simple yet feels high tech. Cons: lack of build in alexa limits capabilities, needs to be very close to echo (limits placement). Single function device. This clock is good but not great. It only does one thing beyond a cheap ikea wall clock, show your timers. If you don't set a lot of timers with alexa, this won't do much for ya. My biggest issue is because it requires an echo nearby to work, it really limits placement. It says 30 ft, but my experience is about 15. If you have an open floor plan living space, this can be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Clock stopped working after the 90 days warranty. One of the worst product on the Echo line. Why is the warranty so short for a clock? It's not a refurbished product.
customer_reviews.author: Bit2in

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but goes through batteries like candy.
customer_reviews.text: They fixed it! Have not changed batteries yet! Love it so much ordering a second clock. ---Previous review- When it works, it's wonderful. You can see multiple timers and the LEDs are nice and bright. The problem is this thing goes though batteries like candy. Every week now i have had to replace with fresh Energizers. It is located maybe 20 away from the Echo Dot it is paired to. I am guessing the bluetooth connection is what is sucking it dry. It would be great if it came with a wall adapter. Unfortunately this is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Belyew

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with FireTV Cube
customer_reviews.text: My FireTV Cube has supplanted a normal Echo in my main living space. I don't understand why these devices are not fully compatible with the accessories (e.g. Wall Clock, Buttons, Etc). It seems like a silly limitation. I ended up moving an Echo Show out to the kitchen and changing the wake word to "Computer" for the purposes of handling timers. Talk about over-kill..
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Bummer, bummer, bummer
customer_reviews.text: So I love the idea of this clock and order one in early 2020. 9 months later I'm ordering my 2nd one...because I love it and have gotten so used to it's features. BAD NEWS...ordering 2nd one simply because 1st one is already broken. It wont pair. Tech line call and no good results. I was offered 15% savings on a new one...I said just replace it...they said they can't...But for the low cost of the clock and the manpower and time it will take to process my 15% I'd think it would be cheaper for Amazon to just replace it and look at the "good will" they would be providing. Especially as my clock is under a year old.
customer_reviews.author: One

customer_reviews.title: Good clock
customer_reviews.text: I like this clock because it links up to Alexa and you don’t have to set the time. Unless the batteries die the time is always correct. It is easy to read and a good size. If you have Alexa and need a wall clock, for the money this is perfect. I use this for work because I have to keep track of time for appointments. It’s easy for me to use because I can just glance over and see what time it is. I can also set timers with Alexa to help with that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I added a faceplate cover by taping over Saran wrap and stretching it tightly. I assume taking it off the wall every month will destroy the hands when I drop it. So I am going to build a double prong pole and drill holes in the bottom so it can be removed without touching the face or dropping it. I configured it downstairs, then moved it upstairs. It seemed to work. It got 15 minutes ahead but the timer lights always lit up, so it was talking to the nearest echo. I deleted it using the Alexa app and added it upstairs and the time has stayed correct. I imagine moving it upstairs didn't really make the time incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Gart

customer_reviews.title: May have some issues at the beginning, turning into a steady performer.
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do or how many times I reset the clock, it won't keep time. It always runs about 20 minutes fast. A clock that won't keep time goes back. RETURN. UPDATE: Got a phone call from Amazon customer support shortly after I posted my review. Great tech on the other end had me factory reset the clock (push the button 5 times) and when the clock finally stops spinning, it should be on midnight. Mine was not. So, she had me take the hands off and reposition them to midnight. Once I re-synched the clock, all was well. Guess QA on the hands placement isn't so great at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: CRECK

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I used this clock during speech therapy sessions for 3 days with great success. It was a great way to time my sessions with a visual cue for the students. Unfortunately, it randomly lit up the 10 minutes from 1-2 yesterday without stopping, making the visual timer useless. I can't find any tech support for this issue so will likely end up sending it back. Too bad since the kids LOVED it until it stopped working. Update: I was contacted by Amazon within 10 minutes of writing this review! They provided the information to help me fix my clock. Its working great now so I'm excited to give it another try next week!
customer_reviews.author: yogaidaho

customer_reviews.title: Great product if it would work
customer_reviews.text: I'll likely reorder this when the design flaws are corrected, but this clock simply would not work and was returned. Based on other reviews, apparently many of these clocks have problems. It paired properly, with orange and blue light and hands moving to 12:00 position. Then a green light comes on for a minute, clock shuts down and becomes inert with hands frozen at 12:00. Amazon's "trouble light" chart has no explanation for a green light. Tried a dozen times, including with replacement Duracell batteries and still no-go. Hope Amazon gets it right, would be a nice add to our Echo system.
customer_reviews.author: James Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this product
customer_reviews.text: I got my wife an echo clock for Christmas. It worked for one day. The person at Amazon had no idea what an echo wall clock even was, and kept thinking I was talking about an echo show. They finally replaced it, and the NEW one doesn't work either! Really very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, Poorly Executed
customer_reviews.text: We're always asking how much time is left on a timer set on an Echo. So, I thought adding this clock would be handy. It is... only if we're talking to the one, specific Echo in our living room (where we have three devices) that it's connected to. If we happen to set a timer on one of the other two devices (just speaking anywhere in the room) the clock is of no additional use (other than a decent looking clock). That specific lack of functionality is pretty disappointing. I would expect to be able to set a timer in the room and have it displayed. Just like the "cancel/check/stop" timer works.
customer_reviews.author: T. Durden

customer_reviews.title: Keeps perfect time
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several times to get "radio" self-setting clocks to work for me. They are very finicky and are hard to get to work with daylight savings time. I gave up and went back to the old fashioned manual type. I was excited to see these go on sale over Christmas and I picked up a couple of them. Obviously you need to have an Amazon echo to use this clock. It was very easy to connect to the Echo and now I have a self-setting clock without the radio hassle. Another cool feature is when you do a timer on the Echo you have it synced with, you get a light-show countdown that is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: There’s a reason the warranty is only 90 days!
customer_reviews.text: Its very cheaply made, but I did enjoy it while it worked. My Batteries died after 5 mos and it only worked 2 more weeks with new batteries. Now it’s completely dead and of course warranty has expired. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jan R

customer_reviews.title: Almost a decent product
customer_reviews.text: The wall clock does a good job in terms of being a clock. It is pretty cool that it sets itself once it connects to your echo. However, it misses on a couple things. 1. The materials on it look cheap. The outside rim casing is a cheap looking white plastic. A $20 target clock looks significantly nicer. 2. It is a little smaller than expected. Most wall clocks are about 3-6 inches wider 3. The timer function is nice but as others have noted, it doesn’t work if you are streaming music over the echo device. Would I recommend this to a friend...probably not. Maybe the next gen or two will improve and be nicer as a show piece.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - Runs through batteries like I go through chips
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it keeps the time. Since my purchase I have had to change the batteries three times, which is like every 5 weeks. And when you change the batteries, the clock needs to be set up again, which in my history takes at least a day with the clock sitting next to the wifi router. When I want to set a timer, and say "Alexe set a five minute timer.", the echo I am near says "OK", but the clock does nothing. The online instructions talk abut looking for the clock under 'Alexa:Devices:Bluetooth' Which sofar has not shown up. Much better to purchase a plain old wall clock.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this, even knowing that it did not really do very much. The batteries die really fast, and there is not an indicator telling you they are dying. And then, you have to get a ladder to get it off the wall (mine is high up) and re-pair it. I have a battery clock that is 20 years old and the batteries still last for months. I'm disappointed. I also find that information on the Amazon web site is too hard to find. I could not find a fast link to it's manual and that should be on the main page. This is a follow up....battery life ruins it
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It is not user friendly,I have tried to pair it so many times with my echo show and it doesn't work. Tried all the troubleshooting instructions, to no avail. Product maybe defective.
customer_reviews.author: Twinbabies

customer_reviews.title: Echo Clock
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it no Stars I would! Worked for part of a day and now it will not connect with may device. Have tried many time to reconnect the device and it never works! Also, there is no cover to the clock so if you planning on using this in the kitchen you will have issues with keeping it clean. Update.... after 6 hours, it has decided to work. Had to re-connect to the device more than 6 times before it decided to work again. SMH
customer_reviews.author: Brian T Heck

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't worked since we purchased
customer_reviews.text: Just so we're clear; I have 2 other Echo Wall Clocks in my home, and the other 2 work fine. However, this one paired for maybe 5 days, then started flashing blue intermittently for about 3 days (adjusting time, or downloading updates), then it just went to a totally random time and stopped moving. We removed the batteries, put in new ones, unpaired/repaired, and tried Q&As and the Amazon Forum... no solutions. I'm disappointed there is no real help online to fix this, and I'd rather not deal with the arduous process of returning and replacing, really... I think it's going to end up in the trash can tomorrow morning.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: If you use Echo timers, reminders & alarms then this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: What a great extension to Echo’s Alexa’s timers, reminders and alarm clocks on a wall clock! I can’t believe I slept on this for so long! I recently moved and was in need of a new wall clock and being that I use Echo everything I decided to purchase this and I’m glad I did! I have so many timers, reminders and alarms set and it’s great to see it visually. Set up was a breeze and I mounted it further than the 30 ft recommendation and it works perfectly! Nice wall clock with all the bonuses! Ignore bad reviews as this is a nice wall clock!
customer_reviews.author: Prestige PRIME Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I loved it....before I hated it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this clock. I am all in on Alexa stuff and this item was great...until it wasn't. I have owned this thing since December and it's now August and I am thinking it should have lasted a little longer than 8 months. I have tried for the past week to get this clock to display the correct time. It won't and dag-nabbit that makes me a little upset. It sits there.....blinks at me.....in various colors..and then it says (ever so faintly)...SUCKER... So this clock is definetly not ready for prime time....unfortunately for me..I won't be waiting until it is ready for prime time. I am moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Rock Star

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for 3 months, then doesn't work, lack of support
customer_reviews.text: Works for for 3 months, then doesn't work and there is basically no support for it besides trouble shooting videos, none of which solved problems. Issues: 1) After 3 months, the time was off by 21 minutes. 2) The only solution offered was a factory reset. Didn't help. 3) So use it for another 3 months with it off by 21 minutes, then it stops working all together. 4) Replace batteries and now it won't pair at all or work. 5) Solution is to unpair, then repair. Doesn't work. 6) Next Solution is to factory reset. Neither works.
customer_reviews.author: Slim02

customer_reviews.title: Who needs an accurate clock?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a digital atomic wall clock that would lose a minute or two every couple of months, and would never set itself since it could not get a signal. I thought this would be a super accurate clock, and I would never have to set the time again. Boy was I wrong. I love looking at a clock and seeing it 20-30 minutes fast. I get that it might disconnect from the Echo, but even if it does how the heck does it get 20 minutes fast overnight?
customer_reviews.author: W. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Trashing.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to install this Amazon Echo Wall Clock. I am 82 years old and it's difficult to reach my kitchen clock to change the battery or the time, as it is high on the wall (where it needs to be) above my kitchen sink. Since it requires four AA batteries and sets time zone changes by itself, I thought it would relieve me of two of those chores each year. Wrong. Clock is a battery pig. Dead after 5 months. Taking it down and throwing it in the trash. Timer was somewhat useful, but then a cheap magnetic timer I can paste to my fridge or stove hood will suffice.
customer_reviews.author: WOTNWABBIT

customer_reviews.title: Important limitation to know about...
customer_reviews.text: My configuration: First gen echo dot with hardwire hookup (3.5mm) to external speaker. This might be why folks are having problems. As of this writing, THE CLOCK TIMERS WILL NOT DISPLAY IF YOU ECHO IS PART OF A MUSIC GROUP. This caused me to have to redo pairing a couple times. I hope Amazon adds a "We want you to know..." to the product description. Better yet, they can fix the problem. If you can deal with that constraint, the clock is great and visual timers are nicely displayed. I may update this review later to, if Amazon addresses this.
customer_reviews.author: PJB

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Kitchen Timer Paired With Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up because I got my parents an Echo Dot. I originally got this because my mother wanted a new kitchen timer and I figured it would be ideal to introduce her to Echo by using it as a timer... she actually really likes it and took to the Echo Dot right away and then her wall clock stopped keeping accurate time, so I replaced it with the Amazon clock and it works great! Plus she can now physically see her timer counting down too, and that helps her also. Now if I can just convince them on a smart thermostat and some smart bulbs. Little steps.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyWrangler

customer_reviews.title: The worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: I have wasted money on some useless junk before but nothing as bad as this. It doesn’t even qualify as a useful clock let alone the other half a dozen or so things it claims to be able to do. I’ve replaced the batteries about three times since I have bought it and it never stays paired let alone on. Buy this if you really feel like being made to be an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have, but not as full featured as it should be.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: -Shows timers. -Easy to read clock. -Normal aesthetics, looks good with everyday decor. Dislikes: -Uses bluetooth, so the clock is disconnected if you are trying to listen to music on the echo device it is synced to. This clock is a little half baked. They should have a clock that can show all timers/alarms regardless of which Alexa created the timer/alarm. This would obviously be a more expensive device, but i think it would be worth it. That being said, it is nice to have a visual for timers from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel Lirot

product_meta.title: Echo Wall Clock - see timers at a glance - requires compatible Echo device
feature_bullets: Echo Wall Clock helps you stay organized and on time.
Easy-to-read analog clock shows the time of day.
Digital 60 LED display shows one, or multiple, timers set through a paired Echo device.
Syncs time to a paired Echo device, including automatic adjustments for daylight saving time.
Requires a compatible Echo device, including Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Show, Echo Plus, Echo Spot, or Echo Input.
Just say, “Alexa, set a 12-minute timer,” and see it count down at a glance on Echo Wall Clock.
Simple to set up and use—just say, "Alexa, set up my Echo Wall Clock.”
Smooth 10" diameter white bezel clock. Includes mounting hardware and 4 AA batteries.
